description: From May 1st, 2020, Austria is enforcing a new hygiene rule, where people, who enter any confined public space, have to wear a mask or something that covers their mouth and nose.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all indoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria announced that people must maintain a social distance of one meter from one another when they are in an open, outdoor public place. The rule does not apply if the individuals are from the same household. The policy is in effect on May 1 and is set to end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria announced that, when entering indoor public places, business establishments and public transportations, individual must be one meter apart from one another if they are not from the same household. Exception to social distance may be applicable if the the amount of passengers on public transportation is too many. The policy applies to religious practices and open-air markets mutatis mutandis. The policy is in effect on May 1, 2020 and is set to end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria announced that people must wear face covering that covers their mouth and nose when they are in public transportations, entering business establishments, and indoor public places. The policy applies also to open-air markets and religious practices mutatis mutandis. The policy comes into effect on May 1, 2020 and is set to end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria announced that people must wear face covering that covers their mouth and nose when they are in public transportations, entering business establishments, and indoor public places. The policy applies also to open-air markets and religious practices mutatis mutandis. The policy comes into effect on May 1, 2020 and is set to end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all indoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria announced that it is the duty of business operators to ensure every employee in a business establishment wears a mask that cover their nose and mouth or other protective tools that can achieve the same sort of protection. This policy applies also to open-air markets and institutions of religious practices mutatis mutandis. The policy is set to begin on May 1, 2020 and end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria announced that, people must maintain one meter social distancing when they participate in a professional activity unless other measures minimizing the infection risk is used. They are also obligated to wear a mask that covers their mouth and nose even where in vehicles (mutatis mutandis) and places where participants agree, even it may not be mandatory by law. This policy is in effect on May 1, 2020 and is set to end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable)

description: On April 30, 2020, Austria prohibited entry to business in the hospitality industry. Exceptions to this policy ("hospitals and sanatoriums; nursing homes and retirement homes; Facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people, including schools and kindergartens; companies if they may only be used by company employees... lodging establishments if food and drinks are served and served exclusively to lodging guests in the establishment," campsite and public transportation with catering services, food deliveries, and occasions due to professional necessity). The policy comes in effect on May 1, 2020 and is set to end on June 30, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 30, 2020, the Austrian government issued relaxation measures and they will come into force starting from May 1, 2020. Due to opening of public spaces, people can attend them but a one-meter-distance rule should be kept in all public spaces
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
From March 12, 2020, Austria issues the recommendation to stop visits to elderly homes and hospitals. Although it is no ban, Austrians are strongly advised to stay away. Exceptions are in place for children as well as for palliative care.
This lasted till May 4. UPDATE: policy is not valid anymore
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Styria from March 13,  requests population to refrain as far as possible from visits to hospitals and nursing homes, Exceptions for palliative care areas. Styria issued a recommendation to hospitals and care centers to forbid visits, which essentially led to a prohibition of any visits. On April 30th, it was announced that, from May 4th, visits in elderly and care homes were allowed again under special preconditions. UPDATE: Visits in elderly and care homes were forbidden until further notice. On April 30th, it was announced that, from May 4th, visits were possible again under special preconditions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From 15 May 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on June 30.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: From 1 May 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions, prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions, prohibited for visitors. The policy is slated to end on June 30. UPDATE: From 15 May 2020, entering sports grounds is now generally prohibited. Exceptions are revised accordingly. Entering the visitor areas of animal parks and zoos is now allowed if conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 for outdoor visitor areas) of the source document are met. In the context of leisure facility restrictions, entering the premises of cruise vessels is now prohibited for those of occasional character ("im Gelegenheitsverkehr"). For dance schools, dancing couples may be exempted if from the same household and each couple is provided a dance floor of 10 m² at the least, private lessons are generally allowed. Drive-in cinemas (for multi-lane motor vehicles) may now also be exempted from restrictions. UPDATE: From 15 May 2020, entering sports grounds is now generally prohibited. Exceptions are revised accordingly. Entering the visitor areas of animal parks and zoos is now allowed if conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 for outdoor visitor areas) of the source document are met. In the context of leisure facility restrictions, entering the premises of cruise vessels is now prohibited for those of occasional character ("im Gelegenheitsverkehr"). For dance schools, dancing couples may be exempted if from the same household and each couple is provided a dance floor of 10 m² at the least, private lessons are generally allowed. Drive-in cinemas (for multi-lane motor vehicles) may now also be exempted from restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 29 May 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds is allowed if conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 3 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 for outdoor sports grounds) of the source document are met. Entering the visitor areas of leisure facilities is now allowed if the conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 for outdoor visitor areas) of the source document are met. Entering the premises of the sex trade industry remains to be prohibited. The policy is slated to end on June 30.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The administration of Vienna has issued new regulations (35. Verordnung) for visits in hospitals, nursing and care homes, starting from the the 29.05.2020. Visits are allowed again but only with mandatory masks and one visitor per 10 m2 in the patient rooms. Patients are only allowed to have one visitor per day, two visitors are only allowed in exceptions (such as childbirth, dementia, citical life phases). Visits of a person with potential symptoms of Covid 19 are still prohibited. Visits of children are only allowed in exceptions.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: From 15 May 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on June 30. UPDATE: From 29 May 2020, the joint admission of multiple interrelated visitor groups may be allowed if minimum distance measures are followed or appropriate safeguards for social distancing are installed. Operators and employees may forego wearing a face mask in situations of customer contact if appropriate safeguards for social distancing are available. Catering industry provisions are extended to August 31. UPDATE: From 29 May 2020, the joint admission of multiple interrelated visitor groups may be allowed if minimum distance measures are followed or appropriate safeguards for social distancing are installed. Operators and employees may forego wearing a face mask in situations of customer contact if appropriate safeguards for social distancing are available. Catering industry provisions are extended to August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 1 May 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions, prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions, prohibited for visitors. The policy is slated to end on June 30. UPDATE: From 29 May 2020, entering sports grounds is now allowed if conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 3 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 for outdoor sports grounds) of the source document are met. Entering the visitor areas of leisure facilities is now allowed if the conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 for outdoor visitor areas) of the source document are met. Provisions are extended to August 31. Entering the premises of the sex trade industry remains to be prohibited until June 30. UPDATE: From 29 May 2020, entering sports grounds is now allowed if conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 3 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 for outdoor sports grounds) of the source document are met. Provisions are extended to August 31. Entering the premises of the sex trade industry remains to be prohibited until June 30.

description: The administration of Lower Austria has issues new regulations for hospital visits since the 01.06.2020. The general regulations for all visitors of patients within hospitals, care homes and other health spaces are the mandatory use of a mask, desinfection of hands, making an appointment beforehand, a minimum 1 meter distance between individuals and a maximum amount of visitors per room. However, individual hospital also have specific additional regulations, which vary in the allowed length of the visit (20 min to 45 min), specific visitation periods and testing when entering the main entrance.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: The administration of Lower Austria has issues new regulations for hospital visits since the 01.06.2020. The general regulations for all visitors of patients within hospitals, care homes and other health spaces are the mandatory use of a mask, desinfection of hands, making an appointment beforehand, a minimum 1 meter distance between individuals and a maximum amount of visitors per room. However, individual hospital also have specific additional regulations, which vary in the allowed length of the visit (20 min to 45 min), specific visitation periods and testing when entering the main entrance. UPDATE: From November 3rd, Austria announced a nationwide lockdown, which includes new regulations on visiting health facilities. Hence, this policy is not valid anymore.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: The administration of Salzburg issued new regulations for hospital visits on the 04.06.2020. Since then patients are allowed to have one visit per day by one person. More visitors are only allowed in exceptional situations, such as childbrith or crisis situations. General hygiene regulations are mandatory mask use, one meter distance and disinfecting hands.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: The administration of Salzburg issued new regulations for hospital visits on the 04.06.2020. Since then patients are allowed to have one visit per day by one person. More visitors are only allowed in exceptional situations, such as childbrith or crisis situations. General hygiene regulations are mandatory mask use, one meter distance and disinfecting hands. UPDATE: From November 3rd, Austria announced a nationwide lockdown, which includes new regulations on visiting health facilities.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: In Tyrol, hospital visit regulations have been allowed again since the 04.06.2020 but only under strict regulations. Patients, who have been staying at a hospital for more than a week, are allowed to have only one visitor per day for a maximum of 30 minutes. For people accompanying a patient into the hospital, Corona tests via smear testing are mandatory. Furthermore, individual hospitals have issues some additional regulations for their specific spaces.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: Upper Austria (OÖ) has announced new hospital visit regulations according to the 4x1 Rule, starting from the 05.06.2020. Under this rule, a patient is allowed one visitor per day for one hour, most likely during the afternoon. Furthermore, hospitalized children are allowed to be visited by both parents, but not silmultaneously. Ambulance regulations stay the same and require 1,5 m distance betewen patients.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: In Tyrol from March 13 Restrictions of visitors also for Tyrol's residential and nursing homes, recommended to install an access control system in the entrance area. Furthermore, all visitors who are granted access to the facilities should be recorded with their name, address and telephone number. UPDATE: The complete ban of hospital visits in Tyrol has been ended on the 05.06.2020 and been replaced by regulated hospital visits under new restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: From 15 June 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of May 29. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on August 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: From 30 May 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds is allowed if conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 3 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 for outdoor sports grounds) of the source document are met. Entering the visitor areas of leisure facilities is now allowed if the conditions according to § 2, section 1, numbers 1 to 3 (§ 1, section 1 for outdoor visitor areas) of the source document are met. Entering the premises of the sex trade industry remains to be prohibited. The policy is slated to end on June 30. UPDATE: From 15 June 2020, when entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), now only social distancing measures are to be followed (also applies to sports grounds and leisure facilities). Face covering is still mandatory for costumers when entering pharmacies and for their operators and employees whenever there is costumer contact (here, provisions with respect to costumers for being exempted from face covering measures are no longer valid). When carrying out sports activities at sports grounds, keeping a minimum distance of 2 metres now generally applies. Provisions for outdoor visitor areas of leisure facilities are no longer valid. UPDATE: From 15 June 2020, when entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), now only social distancing measures are to be followed (also applies to sports grounds and leisure facilities). Face covering is still mandatory for costumers when entering pharmacies and for their operators and employees whenever there is costumer contact (here, provisions with respect to costumers for being exempted from face covering measures are no longer valid). When carrying out sports activities at sports grounds, keeping a minimum distance of 2 metres now generally applies. Provisions for outdoor visitor areas of leisure facilities are no longer valid.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 29 May 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of May 15. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). description: From 15 June 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of May 29. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on August 31. UPDATE: From 1 July 2020, opening hours for the admission of customers are extended and now go from 5 am to 1 am the next day. The allocation of seats is no longer required to be carried out by operators or employees. The obligation to wear a face mask for operators and employees (or having appropriate safeguards for social distancing alternatively) whenever there is customer contact is no longer valid. Self-service may now be allowed if hygienic precautions are in place. Catering industry provisions are extended to December 31. UPDATE: From 1 July 2020, opening hours for the admission of customers are extended and now go from 5 am to 1 am the next day. The allocation of seats is no longer required to be carried out by operators or employees. The obligation to wear a face mask for operators and employees (or having appropriate safeguards for social distancing alternatively) whenever there is customer contact is no longer valid. Self-service may now be allowed if hygienic precautions are in place. Catering industry provisions are extended to December 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 15 June 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), sports grounds and the visitor areas of leisure facilities is allowed if social distancing measures are followed (except for pharmacies where face covering measures are to be followed additionally). Furthermore, entering sports grounds is attached to conditions according to § 8, sections 2 to 5 (§ 1, section 1 and § 8, sections 2 to 5 for outdoor sports grounds) of the source document. Entering the premises of the sex trade industry remains to be prohibited. The policy is slated to end on June 30. UPDATE: From 1 July 2020, provisions for pharmacies now only apply to those that are public. Here, face covering may now be foregone if appropriate safeguards are available alternatively. Provisions for outdoor sports grounds are no longer valid. In the context of sports grounds, carrying out sports activities is (in the case of sports where physical contact is common, in the context of clubs ("Vereinen") or on non-public sports grounds) now only attached to the condition of working out and implementing a COVID-19 prevention concept where provisions are narrowed and reformulated (as per § 8, section 2 of the source document) when compared to the regulatory situation before. Provisions for the carrying out of sports activities through top athletes no longer explicitly refer to instances of falling below social distancing provisions. The carrying out of sports activities at airfields is no longer explicitly attached to social distancing conditions. The prohibition of entering the premises of sex trade facilities expired on June 30. Provisions for business premises, sports grounds and leisure facilities are extended to December 31. UPDATE: From 1 July 2020, provisions for pharmacies now only apply to those that are public. Here, face covering may now be foregone if appropriate safeguards are available alternatively. Provisions for outdoor sports grounds are no longer valid. In the context of sports grounds, carrying out sports activities is (in the case of sports where physical contact is common, in the context of clubs ("Vereinen") or on non-public sports grounds) now only attached to the condition of working out and implementing a COVID-19 prevention concept where provisions are narrowed and reformulated (as per § 8, section 2 of the source document) when compared to the regulatory situation before. Provisions for the carrying out of sports activities through top athletes no longer explicitly refer to instances of falling below social distancing provisions. The carrying out of sports activities at airfields is no longer explicitly attached to social distancing conditions. The prohibition of entering the premises of sex trade facilities expired on June 30. Provisions for business premises, sports grounds and leisure facilities are extended to December 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
In Austria, starting September 1, Austrian Airlines is limiting the exceptions to the mask requirement.
Previously, passengers with a medical letter were exempt from wearing a mask when flying. Now, the medical letter must be written on an AUA-Formblatt, and passengers must provide a negative corona test result.
Since May, passengers have been required to wear masks upon entering the respective terminal until they arrive at their destination.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On September 3, 2020, an Austrian school regulation created a traffic light system for conditions of school operation and closure, based on infection rates in the school and households of pupils. 

The green phase is the least restrictive, with measures such as holding classes outside wherever possible. 

In the yellow phase, additional conditions apply. All people on school premises must wear face coverings in hallways and common rooms. Lessons for wind instruments must be held outdoors, and singing lessons must take place either outdoors or indoors with face coverings. 

The orange phase includes aforementioned rules, plus additional rules. School events are not allowed. School management may schedule classes to begin at different times to avoid congregations of people. No singing or wind instrument lessons may take place indoors. Sports lessons must take place outside where possible, or indoors with social distancing. The number of hours in compulsory subjects may not exceed ten. Temporary offsite lessons must be provided temporarily for grades 9 and above. 

During the red phase, temporary offsite lessons must be provided for all grades. 

Different end dates apply to different provisions of the regulation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Education,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On September 3, 2020, an Austrian school regulation created a traffic light system for conditions of school operation and closure, based on infection rates in the school and households of pupils. 

The green phase is the least restrictive, with measures such as holding classes outside wherever possible. 

In the yellow phase, additional conditions apply. All people on school premises must wear face coverings in hallways and common rooms. Lessons for wind instruments must be held outdoors, and singing lessons must take place either outdoors or indoors with face coverings. 

The orange phase includes aforementioned rules, plus additional rules. School events are not allowed. School management may schedule classes to begin at different times to avoid congregations of people. No singing or wind instrument lessons may take place indoors. Sports lessons must take place outside where possible, or indoors with social distancing. The number of hours in compulsory subjects may not exceed ten. Temporary offsite lessons must be provided temporarily for grades 9 and above. 

During the red phase, temporary offsite lessons must be provided for all grades. 

Different end dates apply to different provisions of the regulation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 1 July 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of June 15. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 14 September 2020, the consumption of meals and drinks in confined spaces is only allowed when sitting at prescribed places of serving. The obligation to wear a face mask for operators and employees (or having appropriate safeguards for social distancing alternatively) whenever there is costumer contact is reintroduced for confined spaces. UPDATE: From 14 September 2020, the consumption of meals and drinks in confined spaces is only allowed when sitting at prescribed places of serving. The obligation to wear a face mask for operators and employees (or having appropriate safeguards for social distancing alternatively) whenever there is costumer contact is reintroduced for confined spaces.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 24 July 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), sports grounds and the visitor areas of leisure facilities is allowed if social distancing measures are followed (except for pharmacies where face covering measures are to be followed additionally). Furthermore, entering sports grounds is attached to conditions according to § 8, sections 2 to 5 of the source document. For business premises, conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of July 3. The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 14 September 2020, the obligation to wear a face mask when entering costumer areas in confined spaces is now valid within all sorts of business premises. This also applies to the entering of sports grounds and leisure facilities. date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Austria from September 21, In restaurants, a maximum of 10 people can sit on one table. Masks have to be worn everywhere when not sitting. Consuming drinks and food is only allowed when seated.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Austria from September 21, masks also have to be worn outside on markets and trade fairs
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 21, 2020, the Austrian government introduced a mask wear policy stating that it is compulsory to wear a mask in the closed train station area across Austria
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 14 September 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of July 1. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 21 September 2020, the admission of visitor groups is again attached to conditions. They may be admitted if consisting of 10 adults at the maximum in addition to their underage children or minors for whom they have the responsibility, or from the same household. The obligation to wear a face mask now also applies to costumers in confined spaces whenever not at their seat. UPDATE: From 21 September 2020, the admission of visitor groups is again attached to conditions. They may be admitted if consisting of 10 adults at the maximum in addition to their underage children or minors for whom they have the responsibility, or from the same household. The obligation to wear a face mask now also applies to costumers in confined spaces whenever not at their seat.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 14 September 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), sports grounds and the visitor areas of leisure facilities is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). For business premises, sports grounds and leisure facilities, conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of July 24. The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 21 September 2020, the obligation to wear a face mask when entering costumer areas in confined spaces now also includes "connective structures of business premises which are structurally connected" (such as shopping centres) and outdoor markets. Provisions for the carrying out of sports activities through top athletes are slightly relaxed when compared to the regulatory situation before. UPDATE: From 21 September 2020, the obligation to wear a face mask when entering costumer areas in confined spaces now also includes "connective structures of business premises which are structurally connected" (such as shopping centres) and outdoor markets. Provisions for the carrying out of sports activities through top athletes are slightly relaxed when compared to the regulatory situation before.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 21 September 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of September 14. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 25 September 2020, conditions with respect to the admission of visitor groups now only apply to confined spaces. For the states of Salzburg, Tirol and Vorarlberg, opening hours for the admission of costumers are limited to between 5 am and 10 pm at the longest (this provision is due to end 3 days after the commencement of the next set of related COVID-19 measures). UPDATE: From 25 September 2020, conditions with respect to the admission of visitor groups now only apply to confined spaces. For the states of Salzburg, Tirol and Vorarlberg, opening hours for the admission of costumers are limited to between 5 am and 10 pm at the longest (this provision is due to end 3 days after the commencement of the next set of related COVID-19 measures).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On October 20, 2020, the Austrian government announced that visitors of old people's and nursing homes must wear mouth and nose protection throughout the visit and there is a fever control at the entrance in Upper Austria. In addition, the visit must take place in a separate area; a maximum of two guests per day are allowed per resident
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On October 20, 2020, the Austrian government announced that visitors of old people's and nursing homes must wear mouth and nose protection throughout the visit and there is a fever control at the entrance in Upper Austria. date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Announced on October 19, 2020, the national government of Austria stated that starting on October 23, 2020, restaurants will have to limit the number of persons per table and professional events, such as soccer games or opera performances, are required to have placed seating.

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Personal Grooming Businesses (e.g. hair salons)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 25 October 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of September 25. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). Exceptions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of September 25. The policy is slated to end on November 22.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: From 21 September 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), sports grounds and the visitor areas of leisure facilities is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). For business premises and sports grounds, conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of September 14. The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 25 October 2020, face covering measures now explicitly do not apply to "wet rooms" in the context of sports grounds. Exceptions to social distancing measures now only apply to sports activities where physical contact is common, to instances in the context of sports activities where shortly falling below minimum distance provisions is typical of the respective sport or to instances of necessary mutual and safety assistance. Additionally, face covering measures now explicitly do not apply to sports activities. UPDATE: From 25 October 2020, face covering measures now explicitly do not apply to "wet rooms" in the context of sports grounds. Exceptions to social distancing measures now only apply to sports activities where physical contact is common, to instances in the context of sports activities where shortly falling below minimum distance provisions is typical of the respective sport or to instances of necessary mutual and safety assistance. Additionally, face covering measures now explicitly do not apply to sports activities.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: As there are many red areas across Austria, starting from 27 October, 2020, the Government introduced new measurements for schools such as compulsory wearing of masks in entrance area for parents or legal guardian and caring people, no school events or excursions, no singing in closed rooms, no mixing of groups, sports offers exclusively outdoors.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On October 27, 2020, the Austrian government tightened its coronavirus measure, specifically a one meter of distance must be kept in public spaces between everyone

description: On October 27, 2020, the Austrian government tightened its coronavirus measures, specifically a mouth and nose protection has to be worn in the following areas: in public transport, subway stations, platforms, stops, train stations, airports and taxis
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 3 November 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions (which are almost the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed and with the addition of COVID-19 prevention concept provisions), prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions (which are almost the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed in general), prohibited. The policy is slated to end on November 30 and replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On November 3, 2020, the Austrian government introduced new Covid-19 protective measures for protection in hospitals and sanatoriums as well as in old people's and nursing homes. Visits are only allowed every 2 days up to and including November 17th: a maximum of 1 visitor per resident per day, a maximum of 2 people within the specified period. Visitors must also either show a negative test result or wear an adequate respiratory mask. The minimum distance must be observed and mouth and nose protection must be worn
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 7 November 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets), sports grounds and the visitor areas of leisure facilities is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). For business premises, sports grounds and leisure facilities, conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of October 25. The policy is slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 3 November to 30 November 2020, previous provisions are replaced by temporary and specific protection measures against the spread of COVID-19. For business premises, these are the same as has been enacted on May 1, with the addition that face mask have to be "close-fitting". For sports grounds, there are the same as has been enacted on  May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed and with the addition of COVID-19 prevention concept provisions. For leisure facilities, these are the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed in general. These changes are slated to be replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1. UPDATE: From 3 November to 30 November 2020, previous provisions are replaced by temporary and specific protection measures against the spread of COVID-19. For leisure facilities, these are the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed in general. These changes are slated to be replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting June 15th, 2020, the Austrian government requires staff in restaurants, who cannot keep a distance of 1 meter from the customer, to continue to wear masks or something to fully cover nose and mouth.

This policy ended on November 3, after new lockdown was implemented and restaurants had to close (only take away service) UPDATE: This policy ended on November 3, after new lockdown was implemented and restaurants had to close (only take away service)

description:
Starting June 15th, 2020, the Austrian government requires staff in restaurants, who cannot keep a distance of 1 meter from the customer, to continue to wear masks or something to fully cover nose and mouth.

This policy ended on November 3, after new lockdown was implemented and restaurants had to close (only take away service) UPDATE: This policy ended on November 3, after new lockdown was implemented and restaurants had to close (only take away service)
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 11 November 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions, prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions, prohibited. For business premises, conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of November 3. The policy is slated to end on November 30 and replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 3 November 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions (which are almost the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed and with the addition of COVID-19 prevention concept provisions), prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions (which are almost the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed in general), prohibited. The policy is slated to end on November 30 and replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1. UPDATE: From 11 November 2020, trade facilities selling goods are, with few exceptions, required to have opening hours that go from no earlier than the time that has been in place in the last 4 weeks based on the workday that is next to the present policy changes, to 7 pm at the longest. UPDATE: From 11 November 2020, trade facilities selling goods are, with few exceptions, required to have opening hours that go from no earlier than the time that has been in place in the last 4 weeks based on the workday that is next to the present policy changes, to 7 pm at the longest.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions (which are almost the same as has been enacted on May 1, yet, slightly narrowed and relaxed in general), prohibited. The policy is slated to end on November 30 and replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1. UPDATE: From 11 November 2020, trade facilities selling goods are, with few exceptions, required to have opening hours that go from no earlier than the time that has been in place in the last 4 weeks based on the workday that is next to the present policy changes, to 7 pm at the longest. UPDATE: From 11 November 2020, trade facilities selling goods are, with few exceptions, required to have opening hours that go from no earlier than the time that has been in place in the last 4 weeks based on the workday that is next to the present policy changes, to 7 pm at the longest.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On Novermber 17, 2020, the Austrian authorities tightened new regulation measures due to an increase in Coronavirus disease cases. One of them is mandatory face coverings in all public spaces
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Austrian government announced that starting from November 17th, 2020, people must keep distance at least one meter away in public transportation and the associated subway stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On November 17, 2020, the Ministry of Health announced that mouth and nose protection must be worn in public transportation like taxi, uber and private car. The policy is in effect until 6 December, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 11 November 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if social distancing, face covering or other infection protection measures are followed (see [type_business_var]). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions, prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions, prohibited. For business premises, conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of November 3. The policy is slated to end on November 30 and replaced by the previous set of policies on December 1. UPDATE: From 17 November 2020, entering (and driving along) the costumer areas of trade facilities for purchasing goods, service providers for utilizing physical services and leisure facilities for utilizing leisure facility services is, with exceptions, prohibited. Entering the costumer areas of business premises (or outdoor markets) is attached to certain conditions. If possible, services ought to be provided electronically. Exceptions to sports ground restrictions are narrowed when compared to the regulatory situation before. For when athletes are tested SARS-CoV-2-positive, restrictions that follow are relaxed when compared to the regulatory situation before. UPDATE: From 17 November 2020, entering (and driving along) the costumer areas of trade facilities for purchasing goods, service providers for utilizing physical services and leisure facilities for utilizing leisure facility services is, with exceptions, prohibited. Entering the costumer areas of business premises (or outdoor markets) is attached to certain conditions. If possible, services ought to be provided electronically. Exceptions to sports ground restrictions are narrowed when compared to the regulatory situation before. For when athletes are tested SARS-CoV-2-positive, restrictions that follow are relaxed when compared to the regulatory situation before.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The administration of Vienna has issued new regulations (35. Verordnung) for visits in hospitals, nursing and care homes, starting from the the 29.05.2020. Visits are allowed again but only with mandatory masks and one visitor per 10 m2 in the patient rooms. Patients are only allowed to have one visitor per day, two visitors are only allowed in exceptions (such as childbirth, dementia, citical life phases). Visits of a person with potential symptoms of Covid 19 are still prohibited. Visits of children are only allowed in exceptions. UPDATE: Due to the rapid increase of COVID-19 cases, this policy does not apply anymore and new regulations exist for hospitals and nursing homes.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries

description: From 23 November 2020, the Federal Ministry for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection in Austria enacts that entering the premises of all modes of operation in the catering industry is allowed if certain conditions are met (see [type_business_var]). Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of November 7. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on December 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Conditions have changed when compared to the regulatory situation of November 1. For some facilities, following these rules is not explicitly mandatory (see exceptions section). The policy is slated to end on November 22. UPDATE: From 23 November 2020, provisions for the admission of visitor groups are no longer valid. The remainder of catering industry provisions remains slated to end on December 31. UPDATE: From 23 November 2020, provisions for the admission of visitor groups are no longer valid. The remainder of catering industry provisions remains slated to end on December 31.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: From 7 December 2020, entering the costumer areas of business premises of any sort (or outdoor markets) is allowed if certain conditions are met (which are the same as had been enacted on November 3, yet, significantly extended). Entering sports grounds for carrying out sports activities is, with exceptions (which are mostly the same as had been enacted on November 3, yet, slightly relaxed and differentiated), prohibited. Entering leisure facilities for entertaining, amusing or recreational purposes is, with exceptions (which are almost the same as had been enacted on November 3, yet, slightly differentiated), prohibited. The policy is slated to end on December 23.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Austria, from 7th of December, retail shops (and services, like friseur) can reopen again. The trade will open again from December 7th, the shops may stay open until 7 p.m. at the latest. It is mandatory to wear mouth and nose protection. For customer areas there is a limit of 10 m 2 per customer.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Austria, from 7th of December, Wherever possible, all services should be switched to home office. In the future, an MNS must be worn at the workplace if the minimum distance is less than one meter. Other suitable protective measures are also possible (permanent teams, partition walls).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Unspecified public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 7 December 2020, the Federal Ministry of Health announced that lessons are held in person for elementary schools, middle schools, special schools, and polytechnic schools. Final classes are taught face-to-face for the upper secondary level. Strict hygiene regulations apply - in general, but especially for objects such as music, exercise and sport or practical teaching. Universities and colleges remain excluded from the direct scope of the COVID-19 measures regulations in the health sector.

description: In Austria, From December 24th, cable cars, gondolas and lifts can be re-entered for leisure purposes. A capacity restriction of 50% applies in closed rooms, mouth and nose protection is also mandatory in the waiting and boarding areas.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From December 24th, 2020, on, cable cars, gondolas and lifts in Austria can be re-entered for leisure purposes. A capacity restriction of 50% applies in closed rooms, mouth and nose protection is also mandatory in the waiting and boarding areas. The formation of car pools and the use of taxis is only permitted if only two people are seated per row of seats (including the driver). Mouth and nose protection must also be worn. There are exceptions for the transport of kindergarden children or for the transport of people with disabilities, if this is necessary due to the number of passengers and when getting on and off. Public transport can still be used. Mouth and nose protection must be worn in public transport and at subway stations, bus stops, airports, etc. and a distance of one meter must be kept.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Transportation (land; water and air)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
From January 25th to February 7th 2021, new social distancing rules apply:
- 2 meters distance is required between people who are not from the same household
- mouth and nose need to be covered with a medical mask from the "FFP2" type. Furthermore, those who do not take part in the mass testing of the respective working place will also have to wear FFP2 masks where otherwise a simpler face covering would suffice, for example while at work or buying food. In instances, where an FFP2 mask is required, only the use of a mask without a breathing valve is allowed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: The Federal Ministry of Education announced that from 8 February, 2021 primary schools start after the semester break with full face-to-face teaching. In the secondary level 1, there is a shift operation with two equally large groups of students. Group A is in school on Monday and Tuesday, group B on Wednesday and Thursday. On the other days, work assignments have to be completed. Here, too, tests are carried out on Monday and Wednesday. On Friday, as before, distance learning is on the program for everyone. Group B begins the following week. The lower school students must also wear mouth and nose protection in their classroom. High school students, however, have to wear an FFP2 mask instead of mouth and nose protection. Tests are carried out twice a week, without a negative test, students cannot come to school. Only those students who also take a test can take part in face-to-face lessons.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Starting from February 8, 2021, the following applies on the transportation in Austria:

1. cable cars, gondolas & climbing aids: In closed and coverable vehicles only 50% of the transport capacity may be used, ie only half as many people may be transported. In addition, an FFP2 mask without an exhalation valve (or mask of the same or higher quality) must be worn. Operators have to implement appropriate prevention concepts based on the risk analysis and the state of the art.    

2. In motor vehicles (private car, taxi, Uber) a maximum of two people per row of seats may be carried (exception: shared household). In addition, an FFP2 mask (or mask of the same or higher quality) must be worn.

3. In other transportation vehicles and surrounding like metro, airport, etc.: An FFP2 mask (or mask of the same or higher quality) must be worn and a safety distance of at least 2 meters must be kept from others.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Transportation (land; water and air)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Austria, there is an expansion of the FFP2 obligation for encounters outside of the own household - Wherever mouth and nose protection was previously required, FFP2 without an exhalation valve (or equivalent or higher) will now apply starting from February 8, 2021. This is true for all public places in closed rooms as well as at workplaces and at all currently permitted events, e.g. funerals. Penalties for disregarding the FFP2 obligation or the safety distance of 2 meters are increased to 90 euros.

description: Announced on March 15, 2021, the federal state of Vorarlberg states the opening of the gastronomy - starting on March 15, 2021 -  with some strict conditions: when entering the restaurant a negative antigen test or a negative PCR test must be presented. Also, guests are required to register to facilitate contact tracing; there must be a distance of two meters between tables, more than four people are not allowed to sit at a table unless they live in the same household; mask compulsory and food and drinks may only be consumed while seated.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

Face masks are mandatory at school.

description: On August 25, 2021, the Austrian government announced a school regulation concerning air quality. For activities involving singing, playing woodwind instruments, and physical activities like sports, additional ventilation is required, as determined by an individual school's hygiene plan. These activities should take place outside whenever possible. When outdoor activity is not possible, students must remain at least two meters apart when playing music, and one meter apart when playing sports, unless like sport required physical contact. The policy applies to the academic year 2021/2022, which began on November 1, 2021, and will end around July 9, 2022.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On August 25, 2021, the Austrian government announced a school regulation concerning air quality. For activities involving singing, playing woodwind instruments, and physical activities like sports, additional ventilation is required, as determined by an individual school's hygiene plan. These activities should take place outside whenever possible. When outdoor activity is not possible, students must remain at least two meters apart when playing music, and one meter apart when playing sports, unless like sport required physical contact. The policy applies to the academic year 2021/2022, which began on November 1, 2021, and will end around July 9, 2022.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Education,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On August 25, 2021, the Austrian government announced a school regulation requiring a three-week safety phase at the beginning of the academic year 2021/2022. During this phase, pupils, teachers, and administrative staff must (1) wear face coverings in hallways and common areas (not classrooms); (2) provide proof of negative coronavirus tests at least once per week, or as often as necessary to demonstrate low epidemiological risk. Teachers and administrative staff are exempt from the testing requirement if they provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19. The policy applies to the academic year 2021/2022, which began on November 1, 2021, and will end around July 9, 2022.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On November 16, 2021, Tyrol announced that FFP2 masks must be worn in professional settings as well as in vehicles used for professional purposes, unless another way of minimizing infection risk is used. The mask requirement can be waived if the use of a mask makes the professional activity impossible or unreasonably difficult. Circumstances that are in accordance with § 20 paragraphs 3, 4, 5 and 6 of the 5th COVID-19 Protection Measures Ordinance can also be exempted. This policy is set to begin on November 17, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On Nov 22nd, 2021 Austria announced that Hospitals and nursing homes will remain open throughout the lockdown, but with stricter rules on visitors (restriction and regulation of government services). Any visitor must adhere to the 2G+ rule, meaning they need proof of vaccination or recovery and a recent negative PCR test. There are also limits on visitor numbers: one visitor per patient per week in hospitals and two visitors per resident per day in nursing homes, though for minors and some especially vulnerable people these limits can be increased.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On 23 February 2022, Austria lifted the 3G requirement for workplaces
Workplaces in Austria will soon lift the requirement for employees to show proof of vaccination, recovery or a negative test as the country relaxes its Covid measures.
The 3G requirement at work has been in place since November 1st and applies to all workplaces where you can’t rule out coming into close contact with others, whether that’s at your desk, at reception or in a kitchen or common area.
Penalties of up to €500 can be issued to employees, and up to €3600 for employers that violate the law.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of 22nd July 2022, people caught not wearing a mask in Vienna, Austria will be contacted and informed of the mask requirement by the security service employees with Wiener Linien. If they still do not comply, they will be excluded from continuing their journey and ultimately may have to pay a €50 fine for violations of the mask requirement.

description: February 25, 2020: With Bulletin N. 90, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended a meeting with EU Health Commissioner, Stella Kyriakides, and the Ministers of Health of those countries bordering with Italy: Austria, France, Slovenia and Switzerland. The Ministers of Health of Germany and Croatia also took part in the meeting. The aim of the meeting was to share and discuss information about the epidemiological situations of COVID-19 in the States. Issues about travelling and movement of goods between countries were also discussed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: Cooperation among different jurisdictional entities (e.g. treaties or agreements among countries or provinces)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: March 11, 2020: With Bulletin N. 107, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health participated in a meeting with Health Ministers of other European countries including Austria, Denmark, France, Germany, The Netherlands, Poland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and UK. During the conference call, each State provided an update on the local epidemiological situation and outlined the measures adopted to fight the COVID-19 emergency.
